result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. JAMES E NEMITZ

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:23 AM Prosecuting attorney Sara Matthews in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant JAMES E NEMITZ in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for JAMES E NEMITZ. 
Offer received, no agreement. 
Trial to be scheduled. 
Bond continued.

BOND COVERS 22CF48, 20CF111, 21CF450 & 21CF790
$500 POSTED 1/27/2022
Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia / syringes unless medically required.
Defendant shall not possess or consume illegal drugs / any prescription drugs not prescribed.
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages
 Defendant shall not go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol during business hours.
Defendant shall not drive without a valid drivers license.
Defendant shall not drive with any alcohol / illegal drugs in system.

10:17 AM Prosecuting attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant JAMES E NEMITZ appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nicholis J Schroeder appeared by video for JAMES E NEMITZ. 
Warrant quashed. 
State requests previously posted bond be forfeited - request denied.
Review hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:17 AM Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court.  Sheila M. Yohnk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
22CF48, 21CF790, 21CF450, 20CF111. 22TR362, 22TR363, 22TR364 riding along.
Defendant was not able to arrange transportation.
Body only- extradite. Stayed until 03/18/2022 at 10:00 a.m.

ADDRESS INFO for JAMES E NEMITZ
Current: 705 Newman Street, Bloomer, WI 54724 United States  (Effective: 02-02-2022)
Prior: 316 W CEDAR ST, CHIPPEWA FALLS, WI 54729
